com.box.sdk

Class BoxMultipartRequest

  • Object
    • BoxAPIRequest
      • BoxMultipartRequest

  • public class BoxMultipartRequest
extends BoxAPIRequest

    Used to make HTTP multipart requests to the Box API.

    This class partially implements the HTTP multipart standard in order to upload files to Box. The body of this request type cannot be set directly. Instead, it can be modified by adding multipart fields and setting file contents. The body of multipart requests will not be logged since they are likely to contain binary data.

      • setContentSHA1

        public void setContentSHA1(String sha1)
        Sets the SHA1 hash of the file contents of this request. If set, it will ensure that the file is not corrupted in transit.
        Parameters:
        sha1 - a string containing the SHA1 hash of the file contents.

      • resetBody

        protected void resetBody()
                  throws IOException
        Description copied from class: BoxAPIRequest
        Resets the InputStream containing this request's body.

        This method will be called before each attempt to resend the request, giving subclasses an opportunity to reset any streams that need to be read when sending the body.

        Overrides:
        resetBody in class BoxAPIRequest
        Throws:
        IOException - if the stream cannot be reset.

      • bodyToString

        protected String bodyToString()
        Description copied from class: BoxAPIRequest
        Returns a String representation of this request's body used in BoxAPIRequest.toString(). This method returns null by default.

        A subclass may want override this method if the body can be converted to a String for logging or debugging purposes.

        Overrides:
        bodyToString in class BoxAPIRequest
        Returns:
        a String representation of this request's body.
